TopicTitle: New to forums but not KSP

Articles.Content: Thought I'd say hey everyone. I have over 1000 hours playing KSP (20 -45 min a session) and have created/updated numerous mods via config file creation/editing for KSP for my enjoyment. I joined the forum to be part of the KSP community because KSP is in my opinion the best game ever made!

Howdy,

I discovered KSP1 about 2 years ago and have put almost 2000 hours in it. .. 3 hour avg session. Lol.

 

Most in VAB or SPH

It seems to be a rough time for KSP on these sort of platforms but we are all hoping it will become something magical.. and most of us can agree that KSP is truly something awesome.

 

On behalf of Jeb & the crew...

Welcome to the forums.

Hi there!  One of us! I have estimated offline KSP trauma for 4000 hours.... still addicted to yeeting Kerbals off the planet.

Yes, i am the guy who created "The Dunatian" in KSP1.

Hi. I played KSP for about an hour almost every day for over 6 months before making my account... almost 2 years ago?!
Nowadays I don't post here or play the game as much anymore. I still fire up the game sometimes and mess around with planes for 15 minutes and that's it.

I think I played almost 600 hours in total but none of that was in Steam so it's a very rough estimate.

Welcome! I have over 10,000 hours in KSP. Lots of marathon sessions 18+ hours, and many great memories! I've got a youtube channel If you'd like to check it out. Just getting started, but I'be got big plans.
https://www.youtube.com/@chrismacbean
 

Cheers, have a good one!

11 hours ago, Meecrob said:

Welcome! I have over 10,000 hours in KSP. Snip...

You are probably one of the most experienced Kerb yeeter. Do you believe in life after death now?

Nah, there are many more with over double my playtime. Unfortunately with the direction KSP2 is going, they are not keeping people like us around. KSP2 seems like its going to be a dumbed-down version of KSP1. I'm trying to keep the KSP1 spirit alive as much as I can with my channel. I just started it, but I hope to have a video a day once I'm up an running.

 

As to the life after death? No, its Perma-Death for my Kerbals. I probably have as many rescue missions under my belt as regular missions lol. I might have a high playtime, but that doesn't mean I was an expert the entire time...far from it actually!

 

Anyways, feel free to ask me anything about the game. This invitation is open to everybody. I want to actually listen to what the community wants KSP2 to be so we can compare and contrast with how its actually shaping up!

Have a good one, everybody

Edited April 11 by Meecrob
